title: Kronecker symbol
summary: In number theory, the Kronecker symbol, written as ( a n ) {\displaystyle \left({\frac {a}{n}}\right)} or ( a | n ) {\displaystyle (a|n)} , is a generalization of the Jacobi symbol to all integers n {\displaystyle n} . It was introduced by Leopold Kronecker (1885, page 770).
